page.title: 03More on Colwick Woods
page.content: On 5th May 1985 at about 11 a.m. we went to Colwick woods we were there for about 2 1/4 hours. Lee,Ian and me were doing a survey Lee did plants trees and mushrooms, Ian did insects and mammals and I did birds. We covered a lot of ground and saw a lot of birds, mammals etc. I saw magpies,blackbirds, swifts, sparrows and many more. Some were singing, some flying and a few were swimming. My dad came with us and we took my dog called Jamie. We also saw bluetits, greattits some mute swans, black headed gulls and a mistle thrush. The most we saw were house sparrows flying in a flock of 27. Colwick woods is such a good area because the lakes for swans etc and woods for robins , house martins etc and the under groth for readbuntings etc.
